summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Kenneth M. Karas regarding the case United States v. Nicholas Tartaglione. It updates the court that video footage from inside the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) from July 22-23, 2019, requested by the defense, has been preserved and the government is obtaining a copy to provide to defense counsel.

persons.name: Kenneth M. Karas
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Nicholas Tartaglione, to whom this status update letter is addressed.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (S4 16 Cr. 832 (KMK)). The letter concerns obtaining video footage related to his time in custody.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who is respectfully submitting this status update letter to the court.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, is providing a formal status update to Judge Karas regarding a case before his court.
Tartaglione is the defendant in a criminal case over which Judge Karas is presiding.

keyFacts: Video footage from inside the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for July 22-23, 2019, was preserved by MCC staff upon a request from defense counsel in July 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office confirmed the video's preservation and is in the process of obtaining a copy from the MCC to make available for defense counsel's review.
The document pertains to the criminal case United States v. Nicholas Tartaglione (S4 16 Cr. 832 (KMK)).
The letter is a formal status update from U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman to presiding Judge Kenneth M. Karas.
